summary.p: Asks Bullinger to evaluate the booklet that he sent him a long time ago through Simon Grynaeus.

div.p: My friendly, very willing service beforehand, dear lord and friend.

If (Since) Master Simon Grynaeus from Basel, my good lord and friend, sent you a booklet along with writings from me, which happened a long time ago, I assure myself therefore my very friendly and trusting request according to the same writing and desire, to inform me of your opinion (thoughts) on this matter. For if I could earn your favor and knowledge, I would be willing.
Dated the second Sunday after Pentecost in the year 37.
To the highly learned, honorable Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich etc., my particularly dear lord and good friend, to his own hands.
